name: Hotel BLOOM!

reviews.text: Me and my boyfriend visited Hotel Bloom a weekend in september for both business and leisure and I have to say, this is a really good hotel.
reviews.title: Great food, great bar and beds to die for

reviews.text: The rooms are clean, modern and have beds to die for. We spent some time in the bar/restaurant Smoods and I can highly recommend it. The food is excellent and fun. It's the kind of food where you can tell the chef had as much fun cooking it as it was eating it. I especially recommend the foie gras wrapped in eatable gold (!) and the carpaccio with ginger sorbet. The service is great, everyone we talked to were really helpful and kind. The breakfast is also really good and has a wide selection of food. Try the pancaces, they are awesome!
reviews.title: Stylish comfortable and affordable
Blooming ridiculous price for breakfast
reviews.text: The hotel has a great location, it only takes about 10 min to stroll down to the city center, and it takes about 15 min to take a cab from (and to) the airport.
I don't think anyone could be disappointed staying here.
reviews.title: nice design hotel conveniently located and very affordable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Bloom hotel as a last minute decision needing overnight accommodations in Brussels. The Hotel is located within a brief walking distance of the Brussels Nord train station, though it should be noted the trek is slightly uphill from the Station, and may head you inadvertently through Brussel's red-light district with a wrong turn.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, excellent value

reviews.text: In Brussels at this hotel because my husband was there for business.
reviews.title: Front desk staff is the best asset of this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a like a holiday Inn got painted white all over. The lobby is very spacious. Has cool seating arrangement. On the right hand side, it has a very cool bar/living room. Wireless available for free everywhere in the hotel. Downstairs has a business center. It has two public computers. Sitting area with some newspaper. Not in English.. so i don't know what they are.
reviews.title: 4 Star Hotel at 2 Star price

reviews.text: Although there is no bellman, the front desk guys are very, very friendly and helpful. They will do anything to help you. We had to fax documents back to the States several times. The front desk faxed them for us over and over again. Always with smile. We called downstairs a few times asking housekeeping items to be sent up to the room. Each time, we got the item right away. No waiting...
reviews.title: Spartan, Chic, Comfortable and Warm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room.... although spacious, it felt really cheap. It felt like no body really put any thoughts into decorating the space. For instance, there is a mirror above the desk. But, the highest point of it is about my chest. Had to bend knees to put makeup on. I am 5'2". There is another mirror behind the bathroom door. But it is dark there. There is no drawers anywhere in the room. We had put everything on the desk, including our shirts, socks, etc. In the bathroom, there is a big open hole under the sink, in the wall - size of a human head. Looks like it has been there for a long time. Nobody cared to fix it.
reviews.title: Luxury hotel in low price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think this would be a good hotel for college students travelling in Europe. Cheap contemporary furniture, but a very cool lobby. Reasonable rates.
reviews.title: Beautifully styled & best bar in town!

reviews.text: Great hotel!! Value for money it is one of the best hotels in Brussels. Funky hotel bar matches modern decor in the rooms/common areas. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great hotel!! Value for money it is one...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights as part of the first leg on a three-city trip to Europe. Hotel BLOOM! was a nice way to kick off the trip.
reviews.title: Nice, stylish hotel a bit outside the city center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, the location didn't seem to great. We walked from Gar Du Norde to the hotel through what didn't look like a wonderful neighborhood. Maybe it was just all the sex shops, and litter, but this part of town was much less attractive than the rest of Brussels.
reviews.title: Very good hotel!!

reviews.text: Luckily the hotel is much more attractive than the walk to get there. The lobby and the breakfast rooms are very trendy and clean.
reviews.title: all you need is there

reviews.text: Our room itself was nice. It was fairly spacious with lots of natural light. The bed was comfortable. I was hoping for one of the rooms on the website with the birds painted all over the walls, but the decoration in our room was not quite as fun. Still, a comfortable place to stay.
reviews.title: Average Brussels hotels, a bit off track from the main sites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Bloom is a super hotel - as you walk into the reception area you can see just how swanky it is - chair swings in the corner and a funky Moroccan themed bar.
reviews.title: Really unique boutique hotel

reviews.text: Service was fine (something other travellers on here have complained about) - but remember when you are checking in you get charged city tax in Brussels.
reviews.title: Good hotel (but not as good as it thinks it is)

reviews.text: Our room was fantastic - very unique - the wall was actually a piece of art, and the carpet looked like grass! However the bathroom wasn't quite as nice.
reviews.title: Amazing weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location - it is about 15 minutes walk to the historic centre and the Grand Place however the Ibis there is more expensive than this much nicer hotel! There is a metro station opposite and it is next to the Botanical Gardens which offer a great place for a picnic (which you can buy from the mini-supermarket across the road).
reviews.title: Trendy and spacious - would recommend with a few cautions

reviews.text: Would definitely stay there again - much better than other hotels in the city we've stayed in.
reviews.title: A new favourite in Brussels

description: Hotel BLOOM! is a unique hotel in the heart of Brussels where no two rooms are alike. Each light-filled room is decorated with a unique hand painted fresco created by a young European artist. You can pick a room to your own taste. From sober to crazy: the choice is all yours.Whether you’re here to work or to have fun, at BLOOM! you will immediately feel a creative vibe that will inspire you and bring you new ideas. Stay with us and live a unique experience.
